runs.comm: good length but straying on the pads, helped behind square on the leg side for one
Evans ventures shortish and outside off, Amjad takes it from there and pulls it wide of midwicket
dug in short, Asif steps away outside leg, swivels on the back foot and pulls it over short fine leg for the first four of the tournament
banged in short and down leg again, following Asif who had skipped away. He manages to half-sweep and half-pull it over short fine leg again for another four
drifting on the pads, tucked backward of square leg for a single
sliding down leg, wide called
good length ball on off, he inches forward and defends it

an appeal for run out. They go to the TV umpire. Back of a length and on the hips, nudged behind square on the leg side. The keeper runs back and across as he hunts the ball down. He ferries a throw at the strikers' end. Asif lunges for the second and makes his ground. He is safe. A direct hit could have left him in trouble
Dropped. On a length and on middle, he sinks to one knee and slogs it, rather skewers to the left of mid-on. Josh Davey from mid-on runs to his left, dives, gets both his hands to it but shells it
bumper outside off, sails through to the keeper. Wide called for height
on a fullish length and outside off, throws his hands at it and scytches it over cover-point
even fuller and attacking the stumps, dug out onto the pitch
good length and straight in line, dabbed in front of point for one via the face of the bat. The fielder attempts a direct hit but misses
Amjad rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and glides it to deep third man for one
dragged short and outside off, Amjad camps back and pulls it firmly to deep midwicket
Ali Evans strikes! Banged in short and cramps Asif for room. He goes for a pull of his own, hit high on the bat and the ball balloons to deep square leg. Asif was hoodwinked by the change of pace..
full and wide outside off, Shahzad slashes and gets a thick outside edge to deep third man
dug in short and on a fourth-stump line, he seeks to pull and only gets an inside edge onto the pad
more short stuff, pulled away towards deep square leg. Macleod runs across, dives to his left and makes a smart stop
very full and swerves in, Shehzad does not meet with the flick and wears it on the pad. But this appeared to be slipping down leg
on a length and outside off, guided down to deep third man
good length and on off, hacked away to the right of deep midwicket off the inside half of the bat
mauled to the boundary. Back of a length and outside off, Shahzad stands tall and forces it through the covers, races away to the boundary
length and outside off, Shahzad loads up and flat-bats it back to the bowler. Davey gets a hand to it but it did not stick. Only a harsh man would deem it a drop
Davey tests Shazad with a slower bouncer, he hunkers down and lets it pass
Shahzad makes room outside leg, Davey follows him with a full toss, which is helped around the corner for a single
good length and on off, Shahzad slaps it to mid-off. Not much power behind that, though
short, parcelled up and dispatched. Dug in short but not much pace on it to pose a threat. Pulled powerfully over midwicket for a six
Shahzad waved his bat around like a sword and falls on it. He hunts for a leg-side heave but ends up getting a leading edge to the covers. Munsey settles under it
good length and on middle, pushed to the off side
floated on middle, Amjad aims to drive and ends up managing an inside edge onto the pad. The ball wanders away in front of the covers
the change of pace goes awry. He pulls pace off it but veers down leg. Amjad can't connect with the glance. Wide
better direction. Slowy on middle, Amjad can't manufacture his own pace as he bunts it back to the bowler
fullish and just a shade outside off, inside-edges it onto his pad. The ball dribbles to the off side
good length ball on off, Shaiman manoeuvres it behind square on the leg side. Nifty wristwork
slippery slower bouncer outside off. Amjad does not spot it, he is early into the pull and only connects with thin air
lifting ball. Back of a length and zipping away outside off with lovely extra bounce. Amjad wants to dab it down to third man. No dice. Beaten
on a length and on middle, nips back in a touch. Not the ideal length to cut, I guess he may have got an inside edge onto the pad
good length ball on middle, lofted over vacant mid-on. There is protection in the deep, though
low full toss on middle, driven down to long-off
nice and loopy on middle, forward and pushed back to the bowler

Davey palms it over for a six. Tripe full toss outside off, Shaiman thumps it over midwicket. Davey runs in, misjudges it, leaps in the air and ends up palming it over the boundary for a six. His day has gotten worse
slapped through the covers
down the track and powered to long-on
slides on with the arm outside off, lashed to long-off
Leask takes down Shaiman with his first ball. He gives this ample air outside off, Shaiman has a crack at it. He does not middle it, carving it to deep cover, where Davey redeems himself right away
half-tracker outside off, camps back and flashes a cut through the covers
pushed back to the bowler, who dives to his right and makes a smart stop
veering onto the pads, mis-hit paddle to short fine leg
pushed through down leg, he does not get hold of the sweep. Gets an single off an inside edge
down the track and dragged in front of long-on for a single
fired full on middle, jabbed to the covers
arm-ball sliding down leg, Amjad is beaten on the sweep. The keeper is beaten as well. Oh well, the umpire gives it a four. Might have got a scintilla of a tickle on it
Amjad holes out to deep backward square leg. Pushed through, Amjad folds low in the crease for a slog-sweep. He hit that reasonably well but picked out Munsey
lobbed up on middle, check-driven past a diving cover fielder to long-off
on a fuller length and outside off, steered to deep third man
fullish and on off, Patil strides forward and pushes it to the covers
angled on off from round the stumps, nearly chipped back to the bowler. Just died down in front of Leask
floated on middle, he goes on the back foot and nudges it to midwicket
straight roller, swept away to deep midwicket
UAE keep finding the fielders. Tossed up and outside off, Shakoor loads up for a slog sweep and drags it to deep midwicket. Munsey collects another catch
slid through on the leg stump, rapped on the front pad but the appeal is turned down
length and on middle, heaved away to long-on
length and on off, Umair aims for a short-arm jab. He does not get hold of it as the ball drops it front of midwicket
lifter, hurries onto Umair. He is late onto the hook, he gets a fat top edge over the keeper for a one-bounce four

a direct hit at the non-strikers' end. On a length and outside off, flayed to mid-off. There is a brief communication breakdown, Patil is sent back. MacLeod moves to his left, gathers the ball and fires an accurate, direct throw. Patil can't slide his bat in time. His bat was outside the crease by the time the bails were dislodged. UAE mired at 66 for 6; superb work from MacLeod
low full toss on off and middle, picked away towards cow corner
good length and skids on to Javed, who sits back in the crease and nudges a single in front of midwicket
pitched up and on off, shuffles across and pushes it down to long-on
too full and on off, Umair gets under it, frees his arms and launches it over long-off
turning down leg, helped to short fine leg

caught on the edge of the boundary at long-on. Fuller and outside off, Umair sinks to one knee, aims for a encore as he looks to launch it out of the park, this time with a slog-sweep. He does not summon enough power/timing behind it and holes out to MacLeod, who reverse cups his hands around it
tossed up on middle, driven to short cover. The fielder dives to his right and makes a sweep
pushed through on a leg-stump line, Tauqir attempts a sweep and top-edges it over short fine leg
looped up outside off and a hint of turn. Tauqir is leaden-footed as he goes for a booming cover-drive and does not connect
floated up on off, chipped down the ground, past the bowler for one

UAE are sliding quickly. A big appeal for caught behind and the forefinger goes up. Watt gives this loads of air outside off and gets it to weave away. Tauqir does not account for the turn. He has a loose waft at it, plays inside the line and nicks it to Cross
straight roller on middle, pushed back to the bowler
flighted and spins on middle, defended
slid through on off, chopped to the covers
width on offer outside off, Naveed latches onto it as he kitchen-sinks it and carves it through backward point for four
Sharif's radar is wrong - he strays down leg. Good take from Cross
good length and on off, driven firmly to long-off for a single
78ks, Sharif sucks pace off this one outside off. He is early into the drive and is beaten soundly
fuller and on off, flicked with the wrists to midwicket
good length and just a shade outside off, poked towards point
slower one outside off, waits on it before dabbing it belatedly to deep third man
too full and straight, tucked through midwicket
floated on middle from round the stumps, pushed to long-on off the inner part of the bat
overpitched and outside off, slapped to the off-side sweeper
veering down leg, wide called
pitched up and on off, check-driven hit to long-off
straight ball outside off, flat-batted thump to long-off
darted outside off, chopped into the covers
much slower through the air and outside off, poked to short third man. End of a fine spell from Leask
might have been a slower ball on middle, chipped to the right of the bowler
slower bouncer outside off, he can't ramp it over vacant slip cordon. Undone by the change of pace
too full and straight, clipped away through midwicket
on a length and on off, Javed sits back and pushes it in front of mid-on for one
sliding onto the pads, twirls his wrists and flicks it wide of short fine leg, through backward square leg
slips in a slowy ball on the pads, glanced straight to short fine leg
darted outside off, Naveed loads up for a cut and ends up chopping it to short third man
Naveed has leathered that. Length and on middle, Naveed sits back in the crease and smokes it over long-on
nudged to the left of short fine leg, diving save
good length and on off, he looks to turn to the leg side and gets a leading edge to the off side
fired on off, pushed to the covers
slides on outside off with the arm, non-turning ball. This is too full to cut, yet Javed carries on with the shot and edges it to Cross
pitched up and slower on off, pushed through the covers
on a length and just a shade outside off, poked out behind point
full and on middle, Guruge gets forward and taps it back to the bowler
slower short ball rises on off, dropped in front of the covers
pacy bumper from Evans, Guruge sinks under it
another of those cutters around off, poked to the leg side off the inner edge as Guruge makes a mess of the cover-drive

UAE have been rolled over for 109. Berrington throws the stumps down at the non-strikers'. Good length and around off, tapped towards point. Big, big, mix up between the wickets. Guruge the last man out for 1
